event_registry_properties.name: action
event_registry_properties.item: Schedule a repair action to replace the affected Field Replaceable Unit (FRU), the identity of which can be determined using fmdump -v -u EVENT_ID. Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.
event_registry_properties.name: description
event_registry_properties.item: A fatal error on the interface between two SC chips has occurred.
event_registry_properties.name: details
event_registry_properties.item:
A fatal error on the interface between two SC chips has occurred.



   SPARC Enterprise M3000 platform:

      The JSC chip can detect these faults, even though only a single JSC chip is present.
      These faults indicate an internal error within the JSC chip.
      All domains are reset and platform is unbootable.


   SPARC Enterprise M4000 platform:

      All domains are reset and platform is unbootable.
        


   SPARC Enterprise M5000 platform:

      All domains are reset.

      One half of the Motherboard identified by "Affects:" in the fmdump output
      is deconfigured after the domains are reset.



   SPARC Enterprise M8000/M9000 platforms:

      This fault can be detected between any two SC chips on the same CMU or
      between two SC chips on different CMU's (if the fault is between two SC chips
      on different CMU's, there will be two CMU's on the suspect list).


         Where the SC chips are on separate CMUs:

            Multiple domains on the platform may be reset.

            CMU that is the first CMU on the suspect list, along with its associated I/O,
            will be deconfigured after the domains are reset.
            

         Where both SC chips are on the same CMU:

           All domains using the CMU are reset.

           CMU and its associated I/O will be deconfigured after the domains are reset.
           


The recommended service action for this event is to schedule the replacement of the affected FRU's.

       LEGEND

      RED        = SUNW-MSG-ID
      BLUE     = EVENT_ID
      GREEN  = FRU



Step 1. Collect the fault message (use one of the following methods):


   Single-line fault message displayed on the XSCF console:

   Mar 20 21:43:12 san-ff2-21-0 fmd: SOURCE: sde, REV: 1.12, CSN: 7860000772  
   EVENT-ID: 4da19369-b495-40f5-b336-6b9c8cbb4bc0
   Refer to %FMAURL%/SCF-8005-AP for detailed information.


   Complete fault message using 'fmdump -m' on the XSCF console:

   MSG-ID: SCF-8005-AP, TYPE: Fault, VER: 1, SEVERITY: Critical
   EVENT-TIME: Tue Mar 20 21:43:12 UTC 2007
   PLATFORM: SPARC-Enterprise, CSN: 7860000772, HOSTNAME: san-ff2-21-0
   SOURCE: sde, REV: 1.12
   EVENT-ID: 4da19369-b495-40f5-b336-6b9c8cbb4bc0
   DESC: A fatal error on the interface between two SC chips has occurred.
   Refer to %FMAURL%/SCF-8005-AP for more information.
   AUTO-RESPONSE: Some number of CPU chips, some number of MAC chips, and some amount of IO will be deconfigured.
   The platform may become unbootable. Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for
   additional information.
   IMPACT: One or more domains will be reset. The platform may become unbootable.
   Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.
   REC-ACTION: Schedule a repair action to replace the affected Field Replaceable Unit (FRU),
   the identity of which can be determined using fmdump -v -u EVENT_ID.
   Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.


Step 2. Collect the output from the 'fmdump -v -u EVENT_ID' command


        xscf> fmdump -v -u 4da19369-b495-40f5-b336-6b9c8cbb4bc0

        TIME                 UUID                                 MSG-ID
        Mar 20 21:43:12.2553 4da19369-b495-40f5-b336-6b9c8cbb4bc0 SCF-8005-AP
          66%  fault.chassis.SPARC-Enterprise.if.fe-sc-sc

               Problem in: hc:///chassis=0/cmu=0/sc=0
                  Affects: hc:///chassis=0/cmu=0
                      FRU: hc://:product-id=SPARC-Enterprise:chassis-id=7860000772:
                           server-id=san-ff2-21-0:
                           part=CA20393-B50X 001AA:revision=0101/component=/MBU_B

          33%  fault.chassis.SPARC-Enterprise.if.fe-sc-sc

               Problem in: hc:///chassis=0/cmu=0/sc=0
                  Affects: hc:///chassis=0/cmu=0
                      FRU: hc://:product-id=SPARC-Enterprise:chassis-id=7860000772:
                           server-id=san-ff2-21-0:
                           part=CA20393-B50X 001AA:revision=0101/component=/MBU_B


Step 3. Contact your Authorized Service Provider.



If you require additional information, please refer to InfoDoc #87402.
event_registry_properties.name: impact
event_registry_properties.item: One or more domains will be reset. The platform may become unbootable. Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.
event_registry_properties.name: response
event_registry_properties.item: Some number of CPU chips, some number of MAC chips, and some amount of IO will be deconfigured. The platform may become unbootable. Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.
event_registry_properties.name: title
event_registry_properties.item: Fatal error on the interface between two SC chips has occurred.
